{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Project Manager",
  "description": "ABL Group is a leading global independent energy and marine consultant working in energy and oceans to de-risk and drive the energy transition across the renewables, maritime, and oil and gas sectors, offering the deepest pool of expertise across marine and engineering disciplines in more than 300 locations globally.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Project Manager

Job Reference: ablgroup/TP/914/185
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Working Hours:&nbsp;40
Department:&nbsp;Marine

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Project Manager. The selected candidate will provide strategic leadership, stakeholder coordination, and full accountability for deliverables.


What will you be doing?


	Lead the team to deliver high-quality outputs on schedule and within budget
	Act as the prime contact for the client and stakeholders
	Manage complex stakeholder relationships across the public and private sectors
	Ensure comprehensive progress reporting to all relevant stakeholders


What are we looking for?


	MSc Degree in Transport Planning, Business Development, or related field.
	Minimum of 15 years of experience managing large-scale public transport utilities
	Demonstrated experience with&nbsp;IFI-funded projects in developing countries is preferred
	You must have the right to live and work in Lagos, Nigeria


Salary
Competitive

Note


	We will be conducting interviews continuously and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate. &nbsp;&nbsp;
	For your application to be taken into consideration, please be advised that you must submit your application via the link provided on this page. &nbsp;
	We look forward to receiving your application.&nbsp;
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "ABL Group"
    
  },

Senior Project Manager Job at ABL Group




        
    

        
        ABL Group is a leading global independent energy and marine consultant working in energy and oceans to de-risk and drive the energy transition across the renewables, maritime, and oil and gas sectors, offering the deepest pool of expertise across marine and engineering disciplines in more than 300 locations globally.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Project Manager

Job Reference: ablgroup/TP/914/185
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Working Hours: 40
Department: Marine

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Project Manager. The selected candidate will provide strategic leadership, stakeholder coordination, and full accountability for deliverables.


What will you be doing?


	Lead the team to deliver high-quality outputs on schedule and within budget
	Act as the prime contact for the client and stakeholders
	Manage complex stakeholder relationships across the public and private sectors
	Ensure comprehensive progress reporting to all relevant stakeholders


What are we looking for?


	MSc Degree in Transport Planning, Business Development, or related field.
	Minimum of 15 years of experience managing large-scale public transport utilities
	Demonstrated experience with IFI-funded projects in developing countries is preferred
	You must have the right to live and work in Lagos, Nigeria


Salary
Competitive

Note


	We will be conducting interviews continuously and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.   
	For your application to be taken into consideration, please be advised that you must submit your application via the link provided on this page.  
	We look forward to receiving your application. 
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "title": "General Manager - Cleaning Service",
  "description": "Draiklinas Limited is an International Facilities Services Limited is an international facilities management company operating global standards. It serves a wide range of clients in Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa, and the Middle East.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager - Cleaning Service

Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	To develop and execute core business strategies in order to facilitate new business developments, whilst providing operational and personnel support to ensure the functionality and sustainability of the organization as a whole.


Responsibilities
Marketing &amp; Business Development:


	Lead the sales, marketing and business expansion activities.


Operations Management:


	Lead, supervise and monitor cleaning and janitor cleaning operations
	Provide strategic operational direction.


Effective People Management:


	Supervise all direct and indirect reports and support performance management systems for all staff of Draiklinas.


Customer Relationship Management:


	Develop and maintain business relationships with all key client and prospect contacts
	Lead and ensure excellent customer relationships.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with a minimum of 7 years of work experience.


Salary
N400,000 - N600,000 Monthly.&nbsp;",

General Manager - Cleaning Service Job at Draiklinas Limited




        
    

        
        Draiklinas Limited is an International Facilities Services Limited is an international facilities management company operating global standards. It serves a wide range of clients in Nigeria, Ghana, South Africa, and the Middle East.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager - Cleaning Service

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	To develop and execute core business strategies in order to facilitate new business developments, whilst providing operational and personnel support to ensure the functionality and sustainability of the organization as a whole.


Responsibilities
Marketing & Business Development:


	Lead the sales, marketing and business expansion activities.


Operations Management:


	Lead, supervise and monitor cleaning and janitor cleaning operations
	Provide strategic operational direction.


Effective People Management:


	Supervise all direct and indirect reports and support performance management systems for all staff of Draiklinas.


Customer Relationship Management:


	Develop and maintain business relationships with all key client and prospect contacts
	Lead and ensure excellent customer relationships.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with a minimum of 7 years of work experience.


Salary
N400,000 - N600,000 Monthly.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Oracle Supply Chain Analyst",
  "description": "Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Oracle Supply Chain Analyst

Job Identification: 217
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities


	Primary responsibility will be leading solution of Oracle ERP Cloud (Fusion) transformation programs.
	This position needs extensive hands-on experience in Oracle ERP, Cloud SCM Procurement, Inventory, Asset Management, Order management.&nbsp;
	Review RD 20, RD 50 for the business with regards Oracle application.
	Conducting of Conference room Pilot documenting issues log and follow up resolution.
	Conducting of User Acceptance Testing, documenting issues log and follow up resolution.
	Prompt resolution of all SCM request sent to helpdesk for User.
	Support of existing EBS SCM Applications
	Ensure working with the stakeholders in the financial organization in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), and Fitment recommendation.
	Need to have a good understanding of the SCM business process with ability to map in the Implementation of Oracle SCM across the group.
	Support the deployment of Oracle Fusion across Sahara Entities.


Minimum Qualification / Experience


	University Degree in Business or related subjects
	Minimum of 4 years of Oracle SCM Cloud functional experience
	Expertise in the following Cloud modules - Order Management Cloud, Product Information Management, Global Order Promising, Inventory and Purchasing
	A minimum of 1 full lifecycle implementation projects covering ERP Financials or Supply Chain Management (SCM) modules.
	Implementation experience of 1 or more Oracle modules in the relevant area.
	Demonstrable experience in several of the following activities on ERP projects; requirements gathering, fit/gap analysis, solution design, functional configuration, conference room pilots / prototype demonstrations, testing, Integration, data migration, training, post &lsquo;go live&rsquo; support.
	Knowledge of basic SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle will be an added advantage.
	Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with quick learning on the job.
	Good interpersonal skills and teamwork required.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skill
	A high degree of initiative and flexibility
	Certifications in Oracle SCM Cloud.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Sahara Group"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {

    "value": "185485"
  },
  "baseSalary": {

    }
  }
}



Oracle Supply Chain Analyst Job at Sahara Group




        
    

        
        Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Oracle Supply Chain Analyst

Job Identification: 217
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities
     

            
    




	Primary responsibility will be leading solution of Oracle ERP Cloud (Fusion) transformation programs.
	This position needs extensive hands-on experience in Oracle ERP, Cloud SCM Procurement, Inventory, Asset Management, Order management. 
	Review RD 20, RD 50 for the business with regards Oracle application.
	Conducting of Conference room Pilot documenting issues log and follow up resolution.
	Conducting of User Acceptance Testing, documenting issues log and follow up resolution.
	Prompt resolution of all SCM request sent to helpdesk for User.
	Support of existing EBS SCM Applications
	Ensure working with the stakeholders in the financial organization in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), and Fitment recommendation.
	Need to have a good understanding of the SCM business process with ability to map in the Implementation of Oracle SCM across the group.
	Support the deployment of Oracle Fusion across Sahara Entities.


Minimum Qualification / Experience


	University Degree in Business or related subjects
	Minimum of 4 years of Oracle SCM Cloud functional experience
	Expertise in the following Cloud modules - Order Management Cloud, Product Information Management, Global Order Promising, Inventory and Purchasing
	A minimum of 1 full lifecycle implementation projects covering ERP Financials or Supply Chain Management (SCM) modules.
	Implementation experience of 1 or more Oracle modules in the relevant area.
	Demonstrable experience in several of the following activities on ERP projects; requirements gathering, fit/gap analysis, solution design, functional configuration, conference room pilots / prototype demonstrations, testing, Integration, data migration, training, post ‘go live’ support.
	Knowledge of basic SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle will be an added advantage.
	Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with quick learning on the job.
	Good interpersonal skills and teamwork required.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skill
	A high degree of initiative and flexibility
	Certifications in Oracle SCM Cloud.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Zenth Technology Limited provides an integrated information system for efficient management and development of modern education, adapted to work with different education systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you a dynamic and motivated individual with a passion for education and technology?
	If so, Eduis is a leading School Management Platform in the Education Industry.
	We are looking to hire an experienced Sales Executive to join our team.


Responsibilities


	Identify and target educational institutions, including primary &amp; secondary schools, as potential clients for our school management software.
	Develop and maintain a strong pipeline of leads through research, networking, and cold calling.
	Conduct product presentations and demonstrations to showcase the benefits and features of the Eduis software.
	Understand customer needs and tailor product solutions to address their specific requirements.
	Collaborate with the sales team to meet and exceed sales targets and objectives.


Qualifications


	HND / Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or related field
	2-4 years of sales experience
	Proven track record in sales, with a focus on software or technology solutions.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong presentation skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
	Self-motivated and results-driven attitude.
	Knowledge of sales and marketing in the education sector.


Perks


	Competitive commission structure and base salary.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking and innovative team.
	Ongoing training and professional development.
	Competitive commission structure and base salary.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking and innovative team.
	Ongoing training and professional development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Brief Cover letter outlining their relevant experience to:&nbsp;recruitment@robertjohnsonholdings.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&quot;Sales Executive Application&quot; as the subject of the email.

Sales Executive Job at Zenth Technology Limited




        
    

        
        Zenth Technology Limited provides an integrated information system for efficient management and development of modern education, adapted to work with different education systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you a dynamic and motivated individual with a passion for education and technology?
	If so, Eduis is a leading School Management Platform in the Education Industry.
	We are looking to hire an experienced Sales Executive to join our team.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Identify and target educational institutions, including primary & secondary schools, as potential clients for our school management software.
	Develop and maintain a strong pipeline of leads through research, networking, and cold calling.
	Conduct product presentations and demonstrations to showcase the benefits and features of the Eduis software.
	Understand customer needs and tailor product solutions to address their specific requirements.
	Collaborate with the sales team to meet and exceed sales targets and objectives.


Qualifications


	HND / Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or related field
	2-4 years of sales experience
	Proven track record in sales, with a focus on software or technology solutions.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong presentation skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
	Self-motivated and results-driven attitude.
	Knowledge of sales and marketing in the education sector.


Perks


	Competitive commission structure and base salary.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking and innovative team.
	Ongoing training and professional development.
	Competitive commission structure and base salary.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking and innovative team.
	Ongoing training and professional development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Brief Cover letter outlining their relevant experience to: recruitment@robertjohnsonholdings.com using "Sales Executive Application" as the subject of the email.

Note: If you're ready to make an impact in the education technology space and contribute to the growth of a dynamic company, we want to hear from you!.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "Altin Resources Limited is a fast-growing mining and precious metal trading company, which was established by a team of seasoned professionals with extensive expertise in the energy, power, and commodities sector. Our focus lies in identifying niche markets and providing innovative and reliable services to advance global trade for the benefit of our customers and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi. Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	A Receptionist&#39;s role is vital in any organization, serving as the first point of contact for guests and visitors.


Key Responsibilities
Here are the key responsibilities and requirements:


	Greeting and Welcoming Guests: Receive and welcome guests, visitors, and clients in a courteous and professional manner.
	Managing Front Desk Operations: Handle phone calls, answer queries, and redirect calls to relevant personnel.
	Administrative Tasks: Perform tasks like filing, data entry, and document preparation.
	Guest Services: Ensure guest satisfaction, handle complaints, and provide information.
	Security Procedures: Follow security protocols for guest access and maintain a safe environment.
	Maintaining Reception Area: Keep the reception area clean, organized, and tidy.


Requirements


	Education: Higher National Diploma or equivalent; some positions may require a Degree in a relevant field.
	Experience: Proven experience as a Receptionist or in a similar role.


Skills:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Customer service-oriented attitude.
	Organizational and multitasking capabilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Excel.
	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Problem-solving skills and adaptability.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;employment.team80@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Receptionist Job at Altin Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Altin Resources Limited is a fast-growing mining and precious metal trading company, which was established by a team of seasoned professionals with extensive expertise in the energy, power, and commodities sector. Our focus lies in identifying niche markets and providing innovative and reliable services to advance global trade for the benefit of our customers and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist
Job Location: Ikoyi. Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	A Receptionist's role is vital in any organization, serving as the first point of contact for guests and visitors.


Key Responsibilities
Here are the key responsibilities and requirements:


	Greeting and Welcoming Guests: Receive and welcome guests, visitors, and clients in a courteous and professional manner.
	Managing Front Desk Operations: Handle phone calls, answer queries, and redirect calls to relevant personnel.
	Administrative Tasks: Perform tasks like filing, data entry, and document preparation.
	Guest Services: Ensure guest satisfaction, handle complaints, and provide information.
	Security Procedures: Follow security protocols for guest access and maintain a safe environment.
	Maintaining Reception Area: Keep the reception area clean, organized, and tidy.


Requirements


	Education: Higher National Diploma or equivalent; some positions may require a Degree in a relevant field.
	Experience: Proven experience as a Receptionist or in a similar role.


Skills:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Customer service-oriented attitude.
	Organizational and multitasking capabilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Excel.
	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Problem-solving skills and adaptability.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: employment.team80@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
